details.title: Voting in 7th and last phase begins
details.content:
Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath was among the first to vote

Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath exercises his franchise at polling booth no. 246 in Gorakhpur. #LokSabhaElections2019 pic.twitter.com/heXwytEqlY

— ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) May 19, 2019

details.title: First in India's electoral history
details.content: BJP chief Amit Shah's roadshow in Kolkata on Tuesday was marred by violence and destruction of social reformer Ishwar Chandra Vidyasagar's bust in a college in north Kolkata. In a first such action in India's electoral history, the Election Commission ordered campaigning in the nine West Bengal constituencies to end at 10 pm on Thursday in the wake of the violence.

details.title: Bypolls scheduled today
details.content: A bypoll will be held in Panaji today, necessitated due to the death of former chief minister Manohar Parrikar in March. Bye-elections will also be held today in four assembly constituencies of Tamil Nadu -- Sulur, Aravakurichi, Ottapidaram (SC) and Thiruparankundram.

details.title: Nitish Kumar upset over long duration of election phases
details.content:
Chief Minister of Bihar, Nitish Kumar: Elections should not be held over such a long duration, there was a long gap between each phase of voting. I will write to leaders of all parties to build a consensus on this. #LokSabhaElections2019 pic.twitter.com/Qrh2ocDJpo

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2019

details.title: Deputy Bihar CM casts vote
details.content:
#LokSabhaElections2019 : Bihar Deputy CM Sushil Modi casts his vote at booth number 49 in Patna. pic.twitter.com/Blwg9EThAX

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2019

details.title: Big faces, big battles
details.content:
Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi: Narendra Modi vs Ajay Rai vs and Shalini Yadav

Bihar's Patna Sahib: Ravi Shankar Prasad vs Shatrughan Sinha

Chandigarh: Kirron Kher vs Pawan Bansal

Punjab's Gurdaspur: Sunny Deol vs Sunil Jakhar

Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur: Ravi Kishan vs Rambhual Nishad vs Madhusudan Tripathi

West Bengal's Diamond Harbour: Abhishek Banerjee vs Nilanjan Roy vs Soumya Aich Roy

West Bengal's Jadavpur: Mimi Chakraborty vs Anupam Hazra vs Bikash Ranjan Bhattacharya

Bihar's Pataliputra: Misa Bharti vs Ram Kripal Yadav

Bihar's Sasaram: Meira Kumar vs Chhedi Paswan

Bihar's Buxar: Ashwini Kumar Choubey vs Jagadanand Singh

details.title: EVM glitches recorded in Patna Sahib
details.content: EVM malfunction reported at booth no.6 in Pant Nagar of Patna Sahib, Bihar (ANI)

details.title: Prime Minister Modi urges people to vote in record numbers
details.content:
Today is the final phase of the 2019 Lok Sabha elections. I urge all those voting in this phase to vote in record numbers. Your one vote will shape India’s development trajectory in the years to come. I also hope first time voters vote enthusiastically.

— Chowkidar Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) May 19, 2019

Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath exercises his franchise at polling booth no. 246 in Gorakhpur. #LokSabhaElections2019 pic.twitter.com/heXwytEqlY

— ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) May 19, 2019

Tamil Nadu: Voting underway for by-election to the Sulur assembly constituency. pic.twitter.com/KZt6vgRJza

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2019

details.title: Bathinda: Akali Dal worker 'attacked' by Congress workers
details.content: A Shiromani Akali Dal worker was allegedly attacked by Congress workers on Saturday night in Bathinda constituency of Punjab represented by Union Minister Harsimrat Kaur Badal. (TV reports)

details.title: Re-polling in Delhi's Chandni Chowk booth underway
details.content: Repolling was declared at polling station no. 32 of Chandni Chowk Assembly Segment after the presiding officer forget to delete the test votes before the actual polling on May 12.

#VotingRound7 | UP CM @myogiadityanath after casting his vote in Gorakhpur on Sunday.
LIVE: https://t.co/vXExVjfmJ8 #Phase7 #ElectionsWithTNIE pic.twitter.com/HMKywctFll

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) May 19, 2019

details.title: Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee’s nephew Abhishek Banerjee casts his vote
details.content:
TMC's South Kolkata Parliamentary constituency candidate said to media:“Whatever he [Narendra Modi] said in meeting on May 15 in Diamond Harbour, he has to substantiate those statements with ample proof and justify what he said. If he fails to do so I will sue him in the criminal and defamation cases. I will drag him to the court." Prime Minister Modi had said that democracy has turned into goondacracy in West Bengal.

A Banerjee, TMC leader: Whatever he (PM) said in meeting on 15May in Diamond Harbour, he has to substantiate those statements with ample proof & justify what he said. If he fails to do so I'll sue him in the criminal & defamation cases. I'll drag him to the court & do the needful pic.twitter.com/IwNVnkyxhr

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2019

TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee had sent a defamation notice to Narendra Modi, demanding an apology from the prime minister for "wildly fabricated allegations" against him at a rally earlier this week. READ FULL REPORT HERE

details.content:

  • Intimidation of voters in Booth no 136 in Jadavpur, alleges BJP

details.title: EVM glitches reported from Punjab
details.content: Technical glitches in Electronic Voting Machines at several places including Ludhiana, Samana and Moga were reported. (PTI)

details.title: Bihar BJP candidate alleges RJD workers of preventing people from voting
details.content: BJP candidate from Pataliputra Ram Kripal Yadav claimed that Rashtriya Janata Dal workers threatened voters (TV reports)

details.title: Bombing in West Bengal's Mathurapur (TV reports)
details.content: An incident of bombing has been reported in Mathurapur constituency's Raidighi area. TMC is being blamed by the villagers.

details.content:

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2019
BJP camp in Barasat in West Bengal set on fire. (TV reports)

Chandigarh: Congress MP Candidate from Chandigarh, Pawan Kumar Bansal casts his vote at booth no 228, Government Model High School, Sector 28 C. #LokSabhaElections2019 pic.twitter.com/2nlTdGNfQW

details.title: BJP's South Kolkata candidate CK Bose says Mamata Banerjee engages in 'jihadi politics'
details.content:
BJP's CK Bose: Last night, I was getting calls from my workers from different booths that they have been threatened by TMC's 'jihadi' brigade that if you sit as booth agents for BJP, you'll be murdered. There's no difference between a terrorist organisation & TMC. #WestBengal pic.twitter.com/OkG6e4l3TT

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2019
Clashes break out between Congress and BJP supporters in Madhya Pradesh’s Umarkot and Petlawad towns under Jhabua Ratlam seat, according to a Hindustan Times report.

Tamil Nadu: A 103-year-old woman has cast her vote in Sulur for by-election to the Sulur assembly constituency. pic.twitter.com/CZNK7fdaFE

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2019

details.title: Bombs hurled outside a polling booth in Basirhat, BJP alleges booth capture
details.content:
West Bengal: Voters hold protest outside polling station number 189 in Basirhat, allege that TMC workers are not allowing them to cast their vote. BJP MP candidate from Basirhat, Sayantan Basu says, "100 people were stopped from voting. We will take them to cast their vote." pic.twitter.com/9qoXEi8YDV

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2019

details.title: TMC slams coverage of PM Modi's pilgrimage
details.content:
Trinamool Congress writes to EC, states, 'Election campaign for last phase of polling for Lok Sabha polls is over, surprisingly Narendra Modi's Kedarnath Yatra is being widely covered by the media for the last 2 days. This is a gross violation of model code of conduct.'

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2019
North Kolkata's BJP candidate Rahul Sinha said he was attacked by a group of men.
An explosion was reported from a polling booth in West Bengal's Islampur where assembly by-election is being held. (NDTV reports)

details.title: Violence in Punjab
details.content:
• An alleged Congress worker was murdered in Taran Taran today in Punjab's Khadoor Sahib parliamentary constituency as he came out of the polling station after casting his vote. He was asked whom he voted for which led to an argument, and he died in the clashes that ensued.
  • Congress and Akali Dal workers clashed in Laroi village of Punjab's Jalandhar parliamentary constituency. The Akalis alleged that the Congress workers attacked them first.

details.title: BJP's Jadavpur candidate Anupam Hazra alleges proxy voting

details.content: Additional forces arrive at polling station number 189 in Basirhat following an alleged bombing incident and BJP MP Sayantan Basu's claim of TMC workers not letting over a 100 people cast their votes. (ANI)

Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur cast his vote in Mandi.
Express photo.#Phase7 #ElectionsWithTNIE

— Express Lite (@xpresslite) May 19, 2019
There was no voting for at least 3 hours at booth 53 in Konarpur of Jadavpur constituency in Bengal. (IANS)

details.title: BJP's Jadavpur candidate alleges more violence by TMC workers in West Bengal
details.content:
BJP MP candidate Anupam Hazra in Jadavpur: TMC goons have beaten up a BJP mandal president, a driver&attacked a car. We also rescued our 3 polling agents.TMC goons were going to carry out rigging at 52 booths. People are eager to vote for BJP but they are not allowing ppl to vote pic.twitter.com/7qlRPg73HA

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2019

details.content:

details.title: Congress chief Rahul Gandhi hails the role women played in the elections
details.content:
Today is the 7th and last phase of polling. Our mothers and sisters have played a key role in these elections, not just as candidates, but also as committed voters whose voices must be heard. I salute them all. #AbHogaNYAY pic.twitter.com/2qspqzkKvY

— Rahul Gandhi (@RahulGandhi) May 19, 2019

details.title: BJP's Bengal in-charge Kailash Vijayvargiya claimed Mamata Banerjee's goons are running West Bengal
details.content: Kailash Vijayvargiya is seen here at a polling booth in Madhya Pradesh's Indore with party MLA Ramesh Mandola. (Photo | EPS)

details.title: Repollingunderway in Andhra Pradesh's Chittoor Lok Sabha constituency
details.content: Nearly 32 per cent voters exercised their ballots in seven polling stations. As of 11 am, 31.92 per cent voter turnout was recorded in the polling stations located in Chandragiri, one of the Assembly segments under Chittoor. (IANS)

details.title: PM Modi's visit to Kedarnath violates MCC: TMC
details.content: The TMC has written to the Election Commission alleging the visit of Prime Minister Narendra Modi to the Himalayan shrine of Kedarnath is a violation of the model code of conduct. READ FULL REPORT HERE

details.title: Fresh violence from Bathinda in Punjab
details.content: Former minister and senior Akali Dal leader Sikhander Singh Maluka’s car attacked at Kangar village in Bathinda parliamentary constituency. Two Akali workers were also injured in the attack. They have been rushed to hospital. Two people have been taken into preventive custody.

details.title: Tension builds up outside a booth in East Kolkata
Clashes erupt after Lalu Prasad Yadav's car gets vandalised, son Tej Pratap Yadav claims the attack was planned for him
details.content:
#WATCH Tej Pratap Yadav's personal security guards in Patna beat a camera person after he allegedly broke the windscreen of Yadav's car. Tej Pratap Yadav was leaving after casting his vote. Yadav has filed an FIR in the incident. #Bihar pic.twitter.com/u1KzKDCGBG

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2019

Tej Pratap Yadav in Patna, Bihar: My bouncers have not done anything. I was leaving after casting my vote when a photographer hit the windscreen of my car. I have filed an FIR in the incident. A conspiracy is being hatched to kill me. pic.twitter.com/60BAIbCxtB

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2019
A crude bomb exploded near Rabindranath Tagore’s ancestral home in Kolkata. (TV reports)

The car of Nilanjan Roy, BJP candidate for Diamond Harbour Lok Sabha constituency, was vandalised in Dongaria area.

West Bengal: BJP candidate for Diamond Harbour Lok Sabha constituency, Nilanjan Roy's car vandalised in Dongaria area of the constituency. pic.twitter.com/Ag09xHu5hZ

— ANI (@ANI) May 19, 2019
Repolling underway in four booths of Kerala's Kasargod. READ OUR FULL REPORT HERE

details.content: <iframe width="100%" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/O7XW1O_ip9c" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

details.title: WATCH | Violence breaks out in West Bengal, cars damaged
Patna locals at Green polling booths gifted saplings after they cast their vote
details.content:
Women voters who cast their votes were given free saplings of fruit-bearing plants after in green polling booths. At a booth in Patna sahib, named 'Vasundhra polling', volunteers had arranged 10000 saplings for free distribution among the biters to drive green messages.
A total of 14 green polling booths have been set up by the Patna district administration across the Patna sahib and the Patliputra LS constituencies for the first time.

details.title: Ludhiana voter arrested for uploading picture on Facebook during polling
details.content: A voter in Ludhiana was arrested for uploading on Facebook a photo he clicked while casting his ballot. Voters are not allowed to carry mobile phones into polling booths

Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh after he and his wife Preneet Kaur cast their votes, Amarinder said, "If Navjot Singh Sidhu wants to challenge (me), he should take it with Congress high command." He was reacting to Sidhu’s comments in Bathinda.

details.content:
• Gorakhpur 38.16%

details.title: BJP approaches CEC over Bengal violence
details.content: BJP writes to Chief Electoral Officer West Bengal, alleging violent incidents in 9 parliamentary constituencies of the state. Letter states, "We have filed 417 complaints to ECI, out of which 227 were resolved, a whooping number of 190 complaints are unresolved"

Polling percentage in the bypolls in Tamil Nadu at 5pm today @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/IQhThqVZ8m

— T Muruganandham (@muruga_TNIE) May 19, 2019
Election Commission: Polling has concluded in 542 parliamentary constituencies across states and union territories.
In 7th phase of Lok Sabha Elections 2019,7.27 crore voters took part of which 3.47 crore were women and 3,377 were persons of third gender.
